· Deal with setbacks

· Power of positive attitude

· Connect as a team

Thankfully, we were able to hold drive-thru graduations at our traditional high schools and early college to provide some closure for our students and families. Stanly Academy celebrated by driving a graduation bus to students' homes and SCOVE held a personalized ceremony for its inaugural graduate.

Please check out our high schools' Facebook pages on August 1 to listen to speeches prepared by the Class of 2020 student speakers.

Congratulations to the Class of 2020! We are very proud of you.

Attention: SCS Sports Delayed
Summer Workouts Postponed

In consultation with local health officials and a thorough review of local COVID-19 data, Stanly County Schools has decided to postpone the restart of athletics. Stanly County Schools was scheduled to begin summer workouts with high school fall sports on Monday, July 6th. This date will now be rescheduled as soon as local data indicates it is safe to do so.

Our decision to push back the restart of athletics aligns with Governor Cooper's directive for our state in light of the rising number of positive cases. In fact, according to the Harvard Global Health Institute, Stanly County ranks seventh in the state in the number of new cases in the last week.

We will continue to monitor the data in our community and consult with local health officials as we work to get our athletes back on the playing field.

It’s not too late to fill out the FAFSA - Free Application for Federal Student Aid!

It’s the first step to free or affordable college. The entire month of June, our state has joined together to create a FAFSA Frenzy in North Carolina to get the word out.

Most jobs require training or education after high school. People with a degree or high-quality credential will double or triple their lifetime earnings compared to a person with a high school diploma only.

Many students don’t realize until they fill out the FAFSA how much money is available to pay for college. Many have to pay nothing at all to get an education.

Go to FAFSAFrenzyNC.com to get started.

Remember, you are not alone in this.
On FAFSAFrenzyNC.com, we have links to a variety of ways to get help in person and online.

2020 Seniors and Families:

Please note the update regarding SCS graduation plans to celebrate our graduates!

Please know that we have carefully considered the feedback we have received regarding graduation.

Each high school will hold a drive-thru graduation on June 12, 2020.
Stanly Early College High School will do a drive through graduation at 6:30 pm on June 9, 2020. * Tentative plan, pending SCC approval.

Each high school will communicate with the students the time(s) for their ceremonies.

In addition, graduates will be celebrated through a senior video, to be posted on the school’s social media and/or website on June 12, 2020.

Although a drive-thru graduation will not be the same, the purpose is to commemorate the end of our students’ high school careers and celebrate their many accomplishments.

If the mass gathering bans are lifted by August 1, 2020, we will still hold traditional ceremonies at the Stanly County Agri-Civic center.

Visit SCS Website for more details:
https://www.stanlycountyschools.org/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1226086&type=d&pREC_ID=1946912
